title: Ticket #1783: Remaining build configuration items post cmake merge.
description:
The following are items which will need to be addressed prior to the next point release:

Build (nmi issues):

  • none at this time

Testing:

  • There are a couple of other intermittent or minor failures

Packaging:

  • All packages should be independently verified. (I will be testing windows)

Release:

  • Punchlist will need to be updated as results.tar.gz contents have changed.
remarks:
2010-Nov-22 07:49:05 by tstclair:
As part of other tickets (#1478), I will be validating the windows modifications (#1657).

2010-Nov-23 20:14:58 by jfrey:
On AIX, the follow libraries must be surrounded by '-Wl,-bstatic' and '-Wl,-bdynamic' on the link line. Otherwise, they get dynamically linked, even though we're giving the paths to the static library files:
  • Globus libraries
  • PCRE libraries
  • Kerberos libraries

2010-Dec-02 22:38:48 by jfrey:
Dan barely beat me in fixing the build from the cmake conversion of classads. Tim's change broke things because the regex classad functions weren't being compiled. To include them you need to set either -DUSE_PCRE or -DUSE_POSIX_REGEX to specify how they should be implemented. Adding extra add_definitions(...) at the top of src/classad/CMakeLists.txt would do it. If using pcre (the desirable option), we'll probably have to tweak the blahp and cream_gahp builds to include the pcre library.

2010-Dec-02 23:45:15 by tstclair:
I'm in the process of testing the posix option as not to perturb the other externals I should have a fix soon.

2010-Dec-07 17:42:00 by kooburat:
  • Verified that the repository update script (manage_repo.pl) works with CMake build
  • Fixed IA64 build
  • Verified that installed package works with simple jobs from vanilla, standard and java universe (IA64 wasn't tested)
  • Need to compress manpages (Debian packaging policy, but isn't critical)

2010-Dec-13 13:46:37 by ziliang:
I've fixed copying of pdb files in the Windows packaging but still have a few more issues to resolve.

2010-Dec-18 13:15:29 by ziliang:
Looking at the build process for curl on Windows, the directory that the make file curl provides wants to be in is the /lib folder. We also need to override a few parameters in that build script cause the curl devs hardcoded paths to the SDK and whatnot. If I can't finish this by Monday, a very likely probability due to exams and commencement, TJ will get a braindump.

2010-Dec-20 14:31:55 by ziliang:
Badly worded commit message....

Curl building still isn't complete, just the cmake stuff around it is now passing in the correct values. However, we need to integrate some kind of patching of the makefile that curl provides before it will actually work because that makefile hardcodes a few paths. Building with a correctly pathed makefile will work based on my test. TJ will handle the rest of it.
